channel.title: Sagemaker on bad to the code
channel.description: Recent content in Sagemaker on bad to the code

item.title: tests with paws on aws
item.description: When trying to find an interface between AWS and Rekognition in a previous post, I was unsuccessful in finding a suitable R library. But today I (partially) caught up with my email backlog and was excited to find in the newsletter from (rweekly)[https://rweekly.org/], that a number of interesting R packages just came out at the beginning of the month. As far as I understand at the moment, there are 11 packages bundled in a (kit)[https://cran.

item.title: happy faces in a bucket
item.description: Remember we downloaded the pictures of our parliamentarians and made a patchwork with them? I looked for a while how to analyse them for gender, age and skin color. One obvious candidate was Rekognition from AWS if only because the instances at my workplace decided to use AWS services. Getting a little bit more familiar with using these seemed therefore like a good choice. I searched for R packages to use Rekognition with, but did not find any.
